title: Bug 110566: Wrong data set result returned when an invalid filter expression is set (row[0])
description: When setting the filter expression to 'row[0] equals to 0', the data set returns an incorrect result. In some cases, it may return a null result set.
OB: When setting the filter expression to 'row[0] equals to 0', the data set does not return the expected result. The returned data set may contain rows that do not meet the filter criteria or may be empty.
EB: When setting the filter expression to 'row[0] equals to 0', the data set should return an error message indicating that the filter expression is invalid or not supported.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the application and navigate to the data set configuration.
2. Set the filter expression to 'row[0] equals to 0' in the appropriate field.
3. Click on 'Apply' or any relevant button to confirm the filter changes.
4. Verify the result set or any relevant display to confirm if the incorrect data is returned or a relevant error message is displayed.
